items.message:
There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain. 
Weather conditions are expected to improve and no further flooding is expected.   
We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

High river levels from today may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible on 29th and 30th November 2025. 

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Slash Lane at Sileby and the Mountsorrel to Sileby road. Minimal rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. River levels at Pillings Lock Gauge continue to rise and will remain high into Sunday 30/11/2025. 

We are closely monitoring the situation & checking flood defences. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Stour and Smestow Brook in the Black Country and South Staffordshire
items.message: River levels along the Smestow Brook and tributaries have peaked and are falling, but flooding remains possible as river levels remain high. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads around Halesowen, Stourbridge. Wombourne, Kingswinford and Kinver. Further light rainfall is forecast overnight. We will continue to closely monitor the situation and stay aware in case further warnings are issued. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. This message will be updated by 11:00 AM on 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding.  Flooding is possible from the morning of 29 November 2025 .  Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem, and Rodington.  We are closely monitoring the situation .  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .  This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, today may lead to flooding. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. The weather forecast is improving, and we expect levels to start returning to normal soon. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 14:00pm on Sunday 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high and may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 29th and 30th November 2025. Minimal rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours. River levels at Whitewater Bridge Gauge will remain high until the evening on 30/11/25. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 30th November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: High tides, strong winds and large waves this evening may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible from 9:00PM this evening, 29/11/2025 to 12:45AM 30/11/2025 and during high tide between 10:00AM and 2:00PM 30/11/2025. Locations most affected will be coastal roads and footpaths. We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid beaches and coastal promenades, which may be flooded. This message will be updated by 5:00PM on 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Teme, River Onny, River Corve

items.message:
River levels have started to rise. Flooding is possible. 

Flooding is forecast from this morning, 29 November 2025 . 

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Teme, River Onny and River Corve and their tributaries. Locations that may be affected include Bishops Castle, Church Stretton, Knighton and Ludlow. Predicted peaks:- Leintwardine 1.0 to 1.2m 29/11 PM, Onibury 1.8m to 2.3m 29/11 PM, Corve 2.4m to 2.9m 29/11 PM. 

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels continue to rise this morning. Flooding is forecast. 

Flooding is possible from this morning, Saturday 29 November 2025 . 

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Predicted peaks:- Llanymynech 3.3m to 3.8m on 29/11/25 PM, Cae Howel 3.8m to 4.3m on 30/11/25 AM 

We are closely monitoring the situation . 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Rising river levels today may lead to flooding.  Flooding is possible from today 29 November 2025 .  Flooding may affect low lying land and roads along the River Wye from Hay on Wye to Ross on Wye. Other locations affected may include the A438 between Letton & Willersey, Byford, Bredwardine & Hereford. Road closures & diversions on the A438 may be in force. Predicted peaks:- Hay on Wye 1.8m to 2.1m on 29/11 PM, Bredwardine 3.6m to 4.0m on 29/11 evening, Belmont 3.7m to 4.1m on 30/11 AM, Old Wye Bridge 3.1m to 3.6m on 30/11 AM, Mordiford 3.3m to 3.8m on 30/11 AM, Ross on Wye 2.5m to 3.0m on 30/11 PM.  We are closely monitoring the situation .  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .  This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Willington, Barrow upon Trent, Swarkestone, Bargate Lane, and the access roads to Willington Meadows, the Twyford Village access road, Church Lane at Barrow, and Ingleby Lane. Rainfall is forecast into this evening, 29/11/2025. Further rainfall is forecast for Monday 01/12/2025. River levels at Shardlow Gauge will continue to rise until tomorrow morning, 30/11/2025, and will remain high but steady throughout the day. Levels may rise further on Monday, in response to additional rainfall. 
We are closely monitoring the situation .

items.description: Loughborough urban watercourses and local tributaries to the River Soar
items.message:
High river levels today and overnight may lead to flooding. 

Flooding is possible on 29th & 30th November 2025 . 

Areas most at risk are low-lying agricultural land and roads including Kingfisher Way, Forest Road and Monarch Way from the Wood Brook, the Grace Dieu Brook, Burleigh Brook, Black Brook, Grammar School Brook, Hermitage Brook, Sileby Brook, Long Whatton Brook, King’s Brook and Kingston Brook. Minimal rainfall is forecast over the next 24 hours. River levels at Loughborough Gauge will remain high into Sunday morning, 30/11/2025. 

We are closely monitoring the situation & checking flood defences. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: Rising river levels today may lead to flooding.  Flooding is possible on 29 November 2025 and tomorrow, Sunday 30 November 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers, especially land around Priory Road. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water.  This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Lud, Louth Canal, Waithe Beck

items.message:
Forecast rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the evening of 29 November 2025 . 
The river Lud in Louth will remain at a constant high level whilst the Flood Storage Reservoirs are in operation.
Our forecasts indicate that flooding to properties isn't likely and therefore flood warnings are not expected to be issued. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . Avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded. 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 30 November 2025 or as the situation changes.
